body:
The One // Kylo Ren CH1

Heyo! I’ve always wanted to start a Kylo Ren fanfic so here it is!

This is hopefully going to be a fairly long series as it begins over a year before TFA so here’s Chapter 1. I hope you guys enjoy <3

——————————————————

Chapter 1

A Flash.

A Crack.

A Rumble.

Sleep. You don’t remember what that word meant anymore. You wanted to think it was the storm. But it wasn’t.

Your Father told you 2 weeks ago today, that you were to be recruited into the First Order as the new budding Apprentice of the notorious, Kylo Ren for your powers of the force.

You were the daughter of the ruler of Tython, the supposed mythical planet of the Jedi Order’s first temple.

Your Father was not one for conflict, and loved all his people, no matter what. He ran his city like a true King, so when he was confronted by the Dark Lord himself, who had sternly threatened the integrity of his beloved home, he did what needed to be done.

Kylo Ren had come for you. He felt your power from across the galaxy almost a century ago, when he was just a young Padawan. His vested interest in you never seemed to cease, and years later, after joining the ranks of the first order, Snoke had confronted him about tracking down a girl who had a force so powerful, she could tear planets from their orbits, he knew, it was the one he had felt oh so many years ago. Kylo Ren negotiated the protection of Tython, for the leaders only daughter, and your father accepted.

You tossed and turned all night as the minutes ticked by faster than you hoped. Tears rolled down your cheeks for what seemed like days now as the time kept plowing onwards,

4:03…4:04…4:05

You could run, you thought for the millionth time

4:06

You could drink poison,

Find a cure for being a force user,

4:07

You reached over and turned on you bed side light, rubbing your swollen eyes, smearing the lingering tears across your cheeks.

You glanced over towards the bag you had packed at the beginning of week, questioning if you had packed all your most treasured belongings, as well as pastimes. After all, you were going to be there for who knows how long. Forever maybe.

You recounted some of the things you were sure you had packed;

CD’s,

CD player, you couldn’t live without your music,

Oil Paints your Father bought you,

Paint Brushes,

The Rings your Mother had given to you before she left to live on her home planet,

A dress your Grandmother had given to you as a gift. It was your favourite. A long, light weight, baby pink dress, with cape like covers that draped over your arms making you look like true royalty,

The rest ranged from books to playing cards. You didn’t pack any clothing as you were assured you’d be given new clothes while there. You assumed they’d be black, and sad.

You left the light on as you turned around and pulled the blanket back over your shoulders, sniffling as you tried to hum yourself back to sleep. You woke up 3 hours later, sunlight streaming through the curtains as you shot up from your bed. You decided to get changed, brush your hair and put on some light makeup, just to cover the endless hours of crying. Out of no where, an overwhelming dread filled your being, you limbs began to ache, your head throbbed and sadness filled your entire being. He was here. You froze, you thought being 18 you would have been mature enough to accept your faith for the good of your people. But all inhibitions vanished as you put your sandals on and ran. You ran past the maids and butlers, through the back door and into the fields, b-lining for the tree line. Your heart pounded as you heard your name being called over and over again, but you ignored it. You kept running, ignoring the pain in your chest, ignoring the aching in your legs. You leaped over fallen branches, swerving through the mazes of trees, pushing past piles of rocks. You didn’t know where you were going, but you couldn’t stop.

Suddenly, you slammed into what felt like a brick wall. Stumbling backwards into a large tree you looked up at what had blocked you, if you thought you couldn’t breathe already, your were sure of it now.

It was him. How did he..? What?

That’s not possible. You turned to your right and tried to run again before noticing the stark white of Storm Trooper armour.

“Stop being stupid, Girl. Let’s go..”

The deep mechanical husk echoed through the trees. You looked around, you were surrounded. You let your head drop in defeat as two troopers took their places on either side of you, ensuring you wouldn’t get away again.

title: i’ll write something 4 u
body: I’m bored send me a situation/AU/pairing/theme/fandom/etc. and i’ll write something short for it! note: if i’m not in the fandom, i might not be able to do it justice

summary: Lmao, this is a thinly veiled burn, not a confirmation of Reylo. "All star special" is a reference to the Star Wars Holiday...
body:
Lmao, this is a thinly veiled burn, not a confirmation of Reylo. “All star special” is a reference to the Star Wars Holiday Special, which is synonymous with cringy and embarrassing. Not to mention off-canon.

I’m not reaching. There is only one “all star special” in Star Wars.

reblog.comment:

I’m not reaching. There is only one “all star special” in Star Wars.

title: Out of Season
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2QFTmCp

by anesor

The war with the Sith has been over for months and maybe it is time for a small spring party… that just happens to be during Yule.

Words: 2479, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 3 of Not So Far, Far Away

  • Fandoms: Star Wars - All Media Types, Star Wars Prequel Trilogy
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Original Female Character(s), Ahsoka Tano, Quinlan Vos, The Usual Cast
  • Relationships: Obi-Wan Kenobi/Original Female Character(s)
  • Additional Tags: lineage feels, holiday story, post ROTS-AU, Crossover, santa caps, Light Angst
